snippet: One more microtrend at this year’s just-closed Design Miami: a preponderance of thoughtful jewelry.
abstract: One more microtrend at this year’s just-closed Design Miami: a preponderance of thoughtful jewelry.
lead_paragraph: Perhaps it was the economics of shipping furniture as opposed to smaller, wearable items, but Design Miami seemed to have far more than its fair share of jewelry this year. In addition to the pieces by blue-chip artists like Alexander Calder and Moriko Mori at Louisa Guinness, there were amazing works by Gerd Rothman, like a necklace with fingerprints, at Ornamentum; cool vintage pieces by Gijs Bakker, a founder of Droog, including a brooch of a high jumper at Caroline Van Hoek; and colorful Op Art-inspired pieces by Carlos Cruz-Diez at Elizabetta Cipriani.

headline.main: Three’s a Trend | Designers Turn to Jewelry
